definition-item.definition-title: ROPES OR CABLES IN GENERAL (joining ropes or cables to one another or to other objects B65H69/00, F16G11/00; {mountaineering ropes A63B29/02}; mechanical finishing or dressing of ropes D02J; {braiding D04C}; decorative ropes or cords D04D; suspension cables for bridges E01D19/16; specially adapted for driving, or for being driven by, pulleys or other gearing elements F16G9/00; electric cables or joints insofar as electrical aspects are essential H01B, H01R)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Ropes and cables and the associated machines and methods for their manufacturing. The main focus of ropes and cables must be to bear tensile loads.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shoe laces
Belts
Roundsling
Yarns and threads
Cables for bridge construction filled with concrete
Hoses
Electrical cables for electricity transport (except if several wires do not serve to conduct electricity but are designed to cope with tensile load D07B1/147)
Umbilicals

section-body.paragraph-text: The use of cables and ropes (e.g. Cable fixed in a special manner to an elevator cage B66B7/00, the lying of cables or ropes in a tyre B60C9/00).
This classification scheme is principally subdivided in four parts, each part having a distinct function:

list-item.paragraph-text: the invention information (i.e. inventive concept and problem to be solved) as it is described in the application is classified in D07B1/00 - D07B9/00;
additional information or sub-inventions, which could be relevant for search purposes, are classified in D07B1/00 - D07B9/00 as Additional Information;

additional information completing the invention information, in the groups range D07B1/00 - D07B9/00, is classified with the Indexing Codes D07B2201/00; D07B2301/00, D07B2401/00 and D07B2501/00, if applicable;

linked Indexing Codes D07B2801/00 - D07B2801/90 to specify the structural function (i.e. wire, filament, fibre or yarn; strand; core; filler etc.), to distinguish between devices and methods or to indicate general knowledge. For example, materials used in cables or ropes are classified in D07B2205/00. The linked Indexing Code D07B2801/10 in combination with D07B2205/00 or lower hierarchy indicates that the specific material is used in the smallest filamentary entity of the rope or cable (i.e. wire, filament, fibre or yarn). The linked Indexing Code D07B2801/18 indicates that the specific material is used as coating. Further details can be found in the indexing scheme relating to ropes or cables in general.

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples:

The invention is directed to a rope wherein a liquid lubricant is used to reduce the internal wear. In order to avoid that the liquid disappears during use, the rope is covered with a jacket. This is claimed in the independent claim. The description and dependent claims further mention that the rope comprises a wire for conducting electricity without defining special constructions. Aramid filaments are preferred as the load bearing entity. HMPE can also be used. The embodiments relate to braided ropes used for fishing nets. To be classified in D07B1/162, D07B1/142, D07B1/025, D07B1/147 , D07B2201/1096, D07B2205/205 linked with D07B2801/10, D07B2205/2014 linked with D07B2801/10, D07B2205/502 , D07B2401/207 , D07B2501/2038.

The invention is directed to an aramid rope wherein a special (i.e. regarding the chemical composition) liquid lubricant is used to reduce the internal wear. The description mentions that the rope is covered with a jacket. It is however clear from the description that the inventive concept relates to the chemical composition of the lubricant which is specially adapted for aramid ropes. To be classified in D07B1/142 , D07B1/025 , D07B1/162 , D07B2205/205 linked with D07B2801/10, D07B2205/50 , D07B2205/502.

The invention is directed to a strand-like tyre cord having a (m+n) structure, wherein m may be 2 to 5. The outer wires of the strands are coated with an adhesion promoting agent made of a special brass composition. Moreover, it is indicated in the description that such strands may be twisted in a rope-like structure to obtain an open structure. To be classified in D07B1/062, D07B1/0666, D07B1/0626, D07B1/0613, D07B2201/1076, D07B2201/2011, D07B2205/3089 linked with D07B2801/18, D07B2401/2095, D07B2501/2046.

The invention is directed to a wire being coated with a special brass usable for tyre cord manufacturing. No information is given to the purpose of this coating. In the embodiment the wire is used to manufacture a 3+8 strand. Alternatively to coating the wire, the entire strand may be coated. The latter is only mentioned as an obvious alternative. To be classified in D07B1/0666, D07B1/0626, D07B2201/2011, D07B2201/2043, D07B2205/3089 linked with D07B2801/18, D07B2501/2046.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ropes and cables

F lexible elongate entities manufactured respectively from fibres/filaments and wires. They can only cope with tensile loads. They cannot bear shear, compressive or torsion forces. Cables may be strand like or rope like. A cable has normally the following structure: wire - strand - rope/cable.Fibrous ropes are always rope like. A fibrous rope has normally the following structure: filament / textile yarn / rope yarn - strand - rope. Fibrous ropes often have a construction different from a laid rope, e.g. a parallel yarn rope, a Kernmantle rope or a braided rope.

definition-item.definition-title: Constructional features of ropes or cables

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
constructional features of ropes and cables.

definition-item.definition-title: {Composite ropes, i.e. ropes built-up from fibrous or filamentary material and metal wires}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
ropes built-up from fibrous or filamentary material and metal in which both have a tensile strength functionality.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ropes built-up from fibrous or filamentary material and metal in which only one of them has a tensile strength functionality

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforcing cords having a rope configuration and a special fibrous core design to carry loads

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Built-up
the material providing tensile strength, normally within a strand

definition-item.definition-title: Ropes built-up from fibrous or filamentary material, e.g. of vegetable origin, of animal origin, regenerated cellulose, plastics

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
only artificial filamentary material including treated natural materials (e.g. viscose).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fishing lines
Mountain guy-ropes or accessories

section-body.paragraph-text: Ropes or cables made respectively from natural fibres and natural staple fibres are classified in D07B5/02 and D07B5/06.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fibrous material
considered to have a limited length whereas filamentary material has an indefinite length.

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising high modulus, or high tenacity, polymer filaments or fibres, e.g. liquid-crystal polymers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ropes built-up from glass fibres
D07B1/02 with the additional Indexing Code D07B2205/3003
Opes built-up from carbon fibres
D07B1/02 with the additional Indexing Code D07B2205/3007

section-body.paragraph-text: high modulus or high tenacity polymer filaments include for example para-aramid, high modulus polyethylene, high modulus polyester, polybenzazole or PIPD.

definition-item.definition-title: {Reinforcing cords for rubber or plastic articles}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforcements or ply arrangement of pneumatic tyres
Textile tyre cords
Driving belts with metal reinforcement bonded by the rubber
Tyre cords
D07B1/06&A (Japanese FI-class)

section-body.paragraph-text: Hybrid cords (i.e. comprising wires and filaments within the same rope or strand) have to be classified in both D02G3/48 and D07B1/0606 or lower hierarchy.

definition-item.definition-title: {the reinforcing cords being characterised by the strand configuration}

section-body.paragraph-text: Strands comprising preformed wires are classified only in D07B1/0646 and lower hierarchy. However, strands normally classified in D07B1/0626 or D07B1/0633 should be given the respective class in combination with D07B1/0646 and lower hierarchy.

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising longitudinally preformed wires}

section-body.paragraph-text: If a strand like cord is claimed with preformed wires, then D07B1/0646 or lower hierarchy is given and not additionally D07B1/062. However, D07B1/0626 or D07B1/0633 may be given.
If a preformed wire is used in the context of a rope like cord, then the document has to be classified in both D07B1/0646 or lower hierarchy and D07B1/0613.

definition-item.definition-title: {the wires being characterised by an anti-corrosive or adhesion promoting coating}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Manufacture of coated wire or bars
Layered products with all layers being exclusively metallic
Alloys based on copper with zinc as the next major constituent
Electroplating baths containing more than 50% by weight zinc
Electroplating baths containing more than 50% by weight copper

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the strand design}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pre-stressed concrete (PC) steel strands for concrete reinforcement

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising liquid, pasty or powder agents, e.g. lubricants or anti-corrosive oils or greases}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ropes or cables with an enveloping sheathing or inlays of rubber or plastics

definition-item.definition-title: {for ropes or rope components built-up from fibrous or filamentary material}

section-body.paragraph-text: Lubricants are classified according to the destination of the lubricant, e.g. a wire rope having the lubricant in a hemp core to lubricate the wires is classified in D07B1/144, whereas a wire rope having the lubricant in an aramid core to lubricate the aramid is classified in D07B1/142.

definition-item.definition-title: {for cables or cable components built-up from metal wires}

section-body.paragraph-text: Lubricants are classified according to the destination of the lubricant, e.g. a wire rope having the lubricant in a hemp core to lubricate the wires is classified in D07B1/144, whereas a wire rope having the lubricant in an aramid core to lubricate the aramid is classified in D07B1/142.

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising elements for indicating or detecting the rope or cable status}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
e.g. elements for indicating or detecting wear or elongation by raising temperature.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or methods for measuring tension in ropes, cables, wires, threads, belts, bands or like flexible members

section-body.paragraph-text: Additionally to be classified in D07B1/148 when the indicating or detecting element is a mark or luminous element.

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising electric conductors or elements for information transfer (D07B1/145 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
electric conductors or elements for signal and information transfer in general from one end to the other end.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: ropes or cables comprising elements for indicating or detecting the rope or cable status e.g. electric wire to detect breakage within the rope

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Insulated conductors or cables with protection against damage caused by wear, mechanical forces or pressure

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tether
a connection rope in the field of renewable wind-energy

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising marks or luminous elements}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Marking devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Additionally to be classified in D07B1/145 when the marks or luminous elements are used for indicating or detecting the rope or cable status.

definition-item.definition-title: Ropes or cables with an enveloping sheathing or inlays of rubber or plastics (D07B1/04, D07B1/10 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making ropes or cables from natural or artificial staple fibres agglutinated by adhesives

section-body.paragraph-text: Documents directed to ropes or cables comprising two layers, one acting as a filler and one extending beyond the perimeter of the rope or cable, are classified in D07B1/165 or lower hierarchy and D07B1/162 and not in D07B1/16.

Documents directed to ropes or cables comprising a single rubber or plastic material, acting as a filler (=penetrating nearly to the centre) and extending beyond the perimeter of the rope or cable, are classified in D07B1/16 only.

Documents directed to belts or elevator belts comprising an extruded jacket in general without any specific emphasis on the jacket are, in addition to their relevant classes in other fields, classified in Indexing Code D07B2201/2087. These documents are not classified in D07B1/16 or lower hierarchy.
Coated or filled strands, even in ropes or cables, are classified respectively in the indexing scheme D07B2201/2042 and D07B2201/2046 and not in D07B1/16 or lower hierarchy.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by a plastic or rubber enveloping sheathing}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
sheathings extending beyond the perimeter of the tension members of the rope or cable.

special-meanings.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: "coating"
"sheathing the rope or cable".

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by a plastic or rubber inlay}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
inlays situated inside the perimeter of the tension members of the rope or cable.

special-meanings.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: "filler"
"plastic or rubber inlay of the cable or rope".

definition-item.definition-title: Grommets {(slings B66C1/12)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roundslings

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Methods of forming roundslings or grommets
Splicing in general

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Grommet
a sling with an eye

definition-item.definition-title: Buoyant ropes, e.g. with air-filled cellular cores; Accessories therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ropes for fishing nets
Life saving ropes

definition-item.definition-title: Flat or flat-sided ropes; Sets of ropes consisting of a series of parallel ropes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Production of belts
Elevator belts
Belts with metal reinforcement in rubber

section-body.paragraph-text: Belts having a flat surface, a "high" aspect ratio and covered over the entire length by an extruded jacket are classified in D07B1/22, if they are of interest, but also in the relevant groups of the other fields, e.g. B66B.
Elevator belts are additionally classified in the Indexing Code D07B2501/2007.

definition-item.definition-title: General-purpose machines or apparatus for producing twisted ropes or cables from component strands of the same or different material

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
general purpose machines and methods for producing twisted ropes or cables from component strands of the same or different material.

definition-item.definition-title: with provision for imparting more than one complete twist to the ropes or cables for each revolution of the take-up reel {or of the guide member}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines with provision for imparting two or more twists with the unwinding spool(s) being located inside the guide member
Double twist winding
Spinning or twisting machines for imparting multiple twist, e.g. two-for-one twisting

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: Making ropes or cables from special materials or of particular form

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
ropes or cables (i.e. products) from special materials or of a particular form.

definition-item.definition-title: {Making parallel wire strands}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Suspension cables, cable clamps for suspension cables

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by their outer shape or surface properties}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fairings in marine applications
Sheaths comprising grooves as protection against damage caused by wear, mechanical force or pressure in insulated conductors or cables

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising postformed and thereby radially plastically deformed elements}

section-body.paragraph-text: Postformed strands are additionally classified in Indexing Code D07B2201/2019.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Postformed
radial plastic deformation via compression

definition-item.definition-title: from straw or like vegetable material

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
all types of natural fibres and filaments e.g. cotton, hemp, paper, animal hair or silk.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making of ropes or cables from natural or artificial staple fibres

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fibrous material
considered to have a limited length whereas filamentary material has an indefinite length

definition-item.definition-title: from natural or artificial staple fibres

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: making of ropes or cables from all types of natural fibres and filaments not in staple form

definition-item.definition-title: from strands of non-circular cross-section

section-body.paragraph-text: Ropes or cables having strands of non-circular cross section obtained by postforming are additionally classified in D07B5/007.

definition-item.definition-title: Details of, or auxiliary devices incorporated in, rope- or cable-making machines; Auxiliary apparatus associated with such machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
details of, or auxiliary devices incorporated in rope- or cable-making machines.

definition-item.definition-title: {Preforming the wires or strands prior to closing}

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Preforming
relates to the plastic deformation to deviate the central axis from being a straight line

definition-item.definition-title: {Postforming of ropes or strands}

section-body.paragraph-text: In case the rope components have to be untwisted for splicing, additionally classification in D07B7/18 is allocated. Ropes or cables are classified in D07B5/007.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Postforming
a radial plastic deformation via compression

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for taking-up or winding the finished rope or cable

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Winding and traversing material on to reels, bobbins, tubes, or like package cores or formers
Devices for guiding or positioning the winding material on the winding form

definition-item.definition-title: for softening, lubricating or impregnating ropes, cables, or component strands thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Auxiliary devices incorporated in rope- or cable-making machines for coating or filling-up interstices in ropes, cables with rubber or plastic

definition-item.definition-title: {Coating or filling-up interstices}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Auxiliary devices incorporated in rope- or cable-making machines for lubricating ropes, cables or component strands thereof
Simultaneous coating of more than one article in extrusion moulding
Extrusion moulding for covering cores

definition-item.definition-title: Auxiliary apparatus

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Apparatuses, i.e. entire functional entities, which are associated to general purpose machines of D07B3/00 and lower hierarchy or special rope/cable making machines, which are not covered by the classes D07B3/00 and lower hierarchy.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Auxiliary apparatuses
include for example bobbin change over devices

definition-item.definition-title: {for making slings}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Slings comprising ropes

section-body.paragraph-text: Methods are classified in B66C1/12 with the additional Indexing Code D07B7/165.

definition-item.definition-title: {for joining rope components}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Methods of, or devices for interconnecting successive lengths of material by splicing

section-body.paragraph-text: Methods are classified in the Indexing Code D07B7/167.

definition-item.definition-title: {for interconnecting two cable or rope ends, e.g. by splicing or sewing (fixation or holding of the ends prior to or during splicing D07B7/162; joining the rope or cable components individually or joining the rope ends by permanent means such as welding, gluing or crimp sleeve D07B7/167; preparing the splice by opening the ends D07B7/18)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter relating to interconnecting two ends of ropes or cables
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: vices or clamps for bending or holding the rope or cable during splicing
joining the rope or cable components individually or joining the rope ends by permanent means such as welding, gluing or crimp sleeve
preparing the splice by opening the ends

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Forming of grommet eyes, i.e. methods of connecting one cable or rope end to the same rope or cable
splicing of filamentary material in general, especially of yarns:

definition-item.definition-title: Binding or sealing ends, e.g. to prevent unravelling

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
methods and apparatuses for binding or sealing the ends of ropes or cables.

definition-item.definition-title: for diagnosing

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Signals indicating failure or excessive conditions, e.g. overheating
